bitReport 0.1.5.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    bitR grey color palette

    bit_pal_grey.Rd

    Using a Rich black for text can make printing difficult and the text less sharp. We recommend body copy is set in C0 M0 Y0 K100. pal_grey provides an additional bitR color palette as a data frame containing 6 colors (shades of black).

    See https://media.unhcr.org/archive/Brand-Book-for-external-partners-2CZ7A2P0CGAY.html for details.

    bit_pal_grey

    Format

    An object of class data.frame with 1 rows and 6 columns.

    See also

    bit_pal for the bitR default color palette with 5 main colors of bit_pal_blue; bit_pal_darkblue for alternative to grey bitR color palettes; bit_pal_primary for a bitR color palette with primary colors; seecol to show color palettes; usecol to use color palettes.

    Other color palettes: bit_pal_blue, bit_pal_darkblue, bit_pal_graphic, bit_pal_green, bit_pal_orange, bit_pal_primary, bit_pal_red, bit_pal_yellow, bit_pal

    Examples

    {
bit_pal_grey
dim(bit_pal_grey)  # 1 6
bit_pal_grey[4]    # preferred (named) color "grey4"
bit_pal_grey[[4]]  # preferred color "grey4" OR "#666666"

# Plotting palette:
seecol(bit_pal_grey)
}
